member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.DefaultConstants
member.summary: This Class is for Infragistics Internal Use Only. The DefaultConstants class is used to provide default values for the Control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox
member.summary: The GroupBox is a Web version of the Windows Forms GroupBox control. It provides a container for grouping controls visually.

member.summary: Default Constructor. Creates a new instance of the GroupBox control.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.CreateControlStyle
member.summary: Creates the Style object which will be used to control the GroupBox's appearance.
member.returns: An instance of an Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style class

member.summary: Writes the HTML representation of this control, to the HtmlTextWriter provided.
member.param: An instance of an HtmlTextWriter

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.OnPreRender(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This method is the last thing to be called, before the control is actually rendered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the Text which will be displayed for this control. The text will appear vertically centered with respect to the Top border. The horizontal alignment is controlled through the TextAlignment property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.TitleAlignment
member.summary: Controls the horizontal alignment of the Text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.PresetMaskResourcePath
member.summary: Supports the Infragistics Preset architecture. For Infragistics Internal Use.
member.returns: The resource path of the xml file, used as the Preset Mask (Filter).

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.GroupBoxRenderBase
member.summary: Provides a base implementation of a Renderer. The renderer is responsible for turning a Control into HTML.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase
member.summary: Provides base functionality for rendering a control in the Misc namespace.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.#ctor(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Renderer. This constructor will throw an ArgumentException if owner is null.
member.param: A valid instance of a GroupBox control.
A flag indicating whether this renderer will be used for Design-Time functionality

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.#ctor(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Renderer, to be used for the Runtime rendering. If you need the Renderer to provide DesignTime data, use the overloaded constuctor - specifiying "true" for the isDesignMode parameter.
member.param: A valid instance of a GroupBox control. This ctor will throw an ArgumentException if owner is null.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.PrepareStyleDefaults
member.summary: PrepareStyleDefaults is called from Control.OnPreRender(). It is your last chance to modify any of the styles, or CssStyleClass objects, before they are written to the page.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.RegisterAllCssClasses
member.summary: Registers all Css classes needed by the owner control, with the page.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.RegisterGeneralJavaScript
member.summary: Registers any JavaScript files needed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.GetAllClassesAndRegisterGenerics
member.summary: Returns the Style element that contains all CSS classes needed for the owner control. This method will also register any "Generic" css classes (classes containing default style information, needed for every control of the owners type.
member.returns: The style tag which will be added to the Page which contains the owner control.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.WriteCssClassesAndRegisterGenerics(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: This method will write all required css classes to support the owner control. It also registers any Generic classes, so that they only have to be rendered one time. This cuts down on the size of the HTML output.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.IsDesignMode
member.summary: Indicates whether this renderer will be used to provide DesignTime html.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelClientSideEvents
member.summary: This class provides a list of "ClientSideEvents", and allows you to specify the name of a javascript function, or "Handler" which should be called when the so named event occurs.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelClientSideEvents.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new WebPanelClientSideEvents object, initializing it as NOT tracking viewstate.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelClientSideEvents.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new WebPanelClientSideEvents object, and will start tracking changes in ViewState accordingly.
member.param: A boolean value indicating whether this object should immediately start tracking changes made, and enter them into ViewState.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelClientSideEvents.ExpandedStateChanging
member.summary: The ExpandedStateChanging event will be fired on the client, before the Panel is expanded or collapsed. You can use oWebPanel.getExpanded() to determine the Panel's current state.
member.remarks: This event can be cancelled by setting oEvent.cancel=true; If the event is cancelled, no action will occur, and the control would continue to function as if the expand/collapse action was never started. If this event is cancelled, the ExpandedStateChanged event will NOT fire. This event will fire when the ExpansionIndicator is clicked, the Header is DoubleClicked, or the oWebPanel.setExpanded() function is called.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelClientSideEvents.ExpandedStateChanged
member.summary: The ExpandedStateChanged event will fire on the client, after the Expanded state of the control has been changed. This event will fire when the ExpansionIndicator is clicked, the Header is DoubleClicked, or the oWebPanel.setExpanded() function is called.
member.remarks: This event can not be cancelled, as it is fired after the action has taken place.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelAutoPostBack
member.summary: This class is used to provide a way to set how the control responds to an action which could fire a ServerSide event.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelAutoPostBack.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class, initially not tracking ViewState.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelAutoPostBack.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class, tracking viewstate as specified.
member.param: Defines whether this object should start tracking any changes made to it, and enter those changes into ViewState.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelAutoPostBack.ExpandedStateChanged
member.summary: Determines whether the ExpandedStateChanged event will force a postback to occur. If true, the control will post back to the server each time the Expanded state is changed on the client. If false, the control will not initiate the postback itself. It instead, will wait for the page to be posted by some other means.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelAutoPostBack.ExpandedStateChanging
member.summary: Determines whether the ExpandedStateChanging event will force a postback to occur. If true, the control will post back to the server each time the Expanded state is changing on the client. If false, the control will not initiate the postback itself. It instead, will wait for the page to be posted by some other means.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.HeaderAppearance
member.summary: This class provides all properties which can be used to control the Header portion of the panel. The header portion is the top most rectangle, which contains the Control's Text and an ExpansionIndicator (used to collapse/expand the panel).

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.HeaderAppearance.#ctor(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl)
member.summary: Creates a new HeaderAppearance object; not initially tracking ViewState changes.
member.param: A valid instance of the control which will 'own' this instance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.HeaderAppearance.#ctor(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new HeaderAppearance, which is set to track ViewState changes accordingly.
member.param: An instance of a control which will 'own' this instance.
Indicates whether this objet should immediately start tracking all changes made to it, and save those changes into ViewState.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.HeaderAppearance.SaveViewState
member.summary: This method is responsible for saving all changes made to this object from the moment it started tracking Viewstate.
member.returns: Returns an object which can be passed into the LoadViewState method, returning the control to the state it was in when this method was called.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.HeaderAppearance.LoadViewState(System.Object)
member.summary: Retuns this object back to the state it was in, when the SaveViewState method was called.
member.param: The state object holds all information needed to return the control to the state it was in when "SaveViewState" was called, in turn creating this state object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.HeaderAppearance.TrackViewState
member.summary: Lets this object know that it must start tracking all changes being made to itslef, so that those changes can be save into ViewState.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.HeaderAppearance.Style
member.summary: If the Url begins with "~/", the url will be resolved to the Application root at runtime. Otherwise, the Url provided here will be appended to the ImageDirectory value. If you have specified the image Directory through a config file (such as the Web.Config), this url will be appended to the config specified value.The Style property returns a Style object which can be used to modify the appearance of the Header.
member.remarks: This property can be used to customize the appearance of the Header rectangle. Expanded Property (Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel) WebPanel Class CollapsedAppearance ExpandedAppearance Expanded Property (Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel)The set of properties used to control the appearance of the Header, when the Panel is Expanded (default state). The set of properties used to control the appearance of the Header, when the Panel is Expanded (default state).

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader
member.summary:
The PanelHeader class is the logical collection of properties which control the Header region of the control. The Header region is the top most rectangle, and contains Text and an
ExpansionIndicator.
member.remarks: This class contains all properties which can be used to customize the Header region.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.#ctor(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl)
member.summary: Creates a new PanelHeader object, initially not tracking changes to its ViewState.
member.param: A valid reference to the control which owns this header.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.#ctor(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new PanelHeader object.
member.param: A valid reference to the control which owns this header.
A boolean value indicating whether this object should immediately start tracking changes to its ViewState.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.Text
member.summary:
A String which will be be displayed inside of the Header, horizontally positioned according to the
TextAlignment Property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.TextAlignment
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of the Text inside of the Header.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.ExpandedAppearance
member.summary: Controls the Default Appearance of the Header region. Contains the set of properties used to control the appearance of the Header, when the Panel is Expanded (default state).
member.remarks:
The ExpandedAppearance is used as the base (deafult) appearance for the PanelHeader. The
CollapsedAppearance will use the values set in this appearance by default. The
HoverAppearance will also use this appearance as the base (default) appearance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.HoverAppearance
member.summary: The HoverAppearance contains all properties which can be used to customize the appearance of the Header, when the mouse is positionied over the Header region.
member.remarks:
The HoverAppearance is used to override values on the currently applied appearance, when the Header is moused over. If the WebPanel is currently Expanded, this appearance will override values of the
ExpandedAppearance, otherwise it will override values of the
CollapsedAppearance. If a value has not been defined in this appearance, it will use the value from the currently applied appearance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.CollapsedAppearance
member.summary: The set of properties used to control the appearance of the Header, when the Panel is Collapsed.
member.remarks:
The CollapsedAppearance uses the
ExpandedAppearance as its base (default). If a value is not defined in the CollapsedAppearance, the value will be take from the ExpandedAppearance. When the Header is moused over, the
HoverAppearance will be applied.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.BackColor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the background color used for the Panel's Header. This property is mapped to the
ExpandedAppearance. Style

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color used for the Panel's Header. This property comes from the Panel's Header.ExpandedAppearance.Style.ForeColor

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used for the Panel's Header. This property comes from the Panel's Header.ExpandedAppearance.Style.Font

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the background image used for the Panel's Header. This property comes from the Panel's Header.ExpandedAppearance.Style.BackgroundImage

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the BorderStyle used for the Panel's Header. This property comes from the Panel's Header.ExpandedAppearance.Style.BorderStyle

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the border color used for the Panel's Header. This property comes from the Panel's HeaderExpandedAppearance.Style.BorderColor

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.BorderWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the border width used for the Panel's Header. This property comes from the Panel's Header.ExpandedAppearance.Style.BorderWidth

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.Cursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor used for the Panel's Header. This property comes from the Panel's Header.ExpandedAppearance.Style.Cursor

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding used for the Panel's Header. This property comes from the Panel's Header.ExpandedAppearance.Style.Padding

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the Height used for the Panel's Header. This property comes from the Panel's Header.ExpandedAppearance.Style.Height
member.remarks: This value is automatically calculated based on the height of the contents displayed inside of the Header. This value may be ignored if the contents of the header require more space than this value allows.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the PanelHeader. This property can be used to hide the Header, and make the Panel look identical to the built in Panel.
member.remarks: This property toggles the "Display" value of the Header. When the PanelHeader is set to Visible=false, the entire height of the control will be used to display the Content of the WebPanel.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader.ExpansionIndicator
member.summary: Gets the ExpansionIndicator object. The ExpansionIndicator contains all properties related to the 'ImageButton' located at the right edge of the PanelHeader.
member.remarks: The ExpansionIndicator is used to show the current expanded state of the panel, as well as allow you to change the current state by clicking on the image shown. If you wish to hide the Inidcator, you can set it's width and height to 0, or supply a transparent image.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.RenderUpLevelPanel
member.summary: The RenderUPLevelPanel class is used to provide Rendering support for the Panel, and is not intended to be used directly.
member.remarks: This class provides Rendering support, and is not intended to be used directly.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TwoStateImageButton
member.summary: Provides an image which can be toggled between two states, each state having its own Url.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TwoStateImageButton.#ctor(Infragistics.WebUI.WebControls.IProvideImageDirectoryResolution,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new TwoStateImageButton, using the parameters specified. The IProvideImageDirectoryResolution object is not required, but is recommended for providing Url resolution and accounting for Web.Config settings.
member.param: An instance of an object which implements the IProvideImageDirectoryResolution interface. While not required, this parameter should be specified in order for the TwoStateImageButton to accurately determine the full path of the Image Url provided.
A boolean value indicating whether this control should immediately start tracking any ViewState changes.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TwoStateImageButton.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new TwoStateImageButton, initially not tracking changes to its ViewState.
member.remarks: When using this constructor, the TwoStateImageButton created will not be able to provide any ImageDirectoryResolution. It will simply render the Image Url as it was set.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TwoStateImageButton.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Writes the object out as an HTML Image.
member.param: A valid instance of an HtmlTextWriter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TwoStateImageButton.Url
member.summary:
The URL of the image to be displayed. This property is the same as the
ExpandedImageUrl Property

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TwoStateImageButton.ExpandedImageUrl
member.summary: The Url of an image to be displayed when the control is in the Expanded state
member.remarks: If the Url begins with "~/", the url will be resolved to the Application root at runtime. Otherwise, the Url provided here will be appended to the ImageDirectory value. If you have specified the image Directory through a config file (such as the Web.Config), this url will be appended to the config specified value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TwoStateImageButton.CollapsedImageUrl
member.remarks: If the Url begins with "~/", the url will be resolved to the Application root at runtime. Otherwise, the Url provided here will be appended to the ImageDirectory value. If you have specified the image Directory through a config file (such as the Web.Config), this url will be appended to the config specified value.
member.summary: The Url of an image to be displayed when the control is in the Collapsed state

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel
member.summary: The WebPanel is a container control, which can be used to group content at design-time or run-time. The WebPanel is also used to control the display of that content at runtime. The WebPanel consists of two major regions. The top region (PanelHeader), is mainly provided as a means to expand or collapse the panel. When a panel is Expanded, its contents are visible. When the panel is collapsed, its contents are completely hidden, and the panel shrinks to show only its Header.
member.remarks: The WebPanel acts as a container control, displaying all controls contained in it's Controls collection. It also allows it's contents to be easily hidden, or re-displayed on the client by means of the PanelHeader.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a WebPanel
member.remarks: This is the Default Constructor, used to create a new instance of a WebPanel. If you wish to create a WebPanel dynamically, be sure to add it to the Page's Form control, and not just directly to the Page.Controls collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.System#Web#UI#IPostBackEventHandler#RaisePostBackEvent(System.String)
member.summary: The RaisePostBackEvent will be used for downlevel browsers only.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.ExpandedStateChanged
member.summary: The ExpandedStateChangedEvent can be used to handle Expand events for the WebPanel. An ExpandedStateChangedEvent will fire when the panel is expanded or collapsed. Use the AutoPostBack property to control whether the WebPanel postsback in response to a change in the Expanded state.
member.remarks: You can determine the current state of the control, by checking the Expanded property. Its previous state would be the opposite of its current state.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.ExpandedStateChanging
member.summary: The ExpandedStateChangingEvent can be used to handle Expanding events for the WebPanel. An ExpandedStateChangingEvent will fire when the panel is about to expand or collapse. Use the AutoPostBack property to control whether the WebPanel will postsback in response to this event (before the Expanded state has actually changed).
member.remarks: You can determine the current state of the control, by checking the Expanded Property. The state the control will be in after this event fires (unless the event is cancelled) is the opposite of the current state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.Text
member.summary: The Text displayed in the Header. This property is the same as the Text Property (Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader)
member.remarks:
The Text's Horizontal alignment can be set by the
TextAlignment Property (Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.PanelHeader)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.PanelStyle
member.summary: The PanelStyle controls the appearance of the area below the PanelHeader.
member.remarks: The PanelStyle can be used to customize the appearance of the Conten-Area region of this control. Use the Header Appearances to customize the appearance of the Header region.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.Header
member.summary: Gets the object which holds all settings for the header, or "Title Bar" portion of this panel.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.AutoPostBack
member.summary: The AutoPostBack property controls the behavior of ServerSide event handlers. Use these properties to determine if a ServerSideEvent should force a postback to occur, the instant the event is fired.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: ClientSideEvents can be used to add dynamic behavior to the control, which exists only on the Client (using JavaScript functions)
member.remarks: Use the properties of this object, to set the name of the function which can be used to handle events which occur on the client. These events can be used to create dynamic behavior with out costly postbacks to the Server.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.Expanded
member.summary: The Expanded property controls the display of the Contents which this control owns. The WebPanel will display any control added to its Controls collection, inside of a Content-Area. This is the lower region of the control, displayed below the Header.
member.remarks: The Expanded property can be used to control the display of the content which this WebPanel contains. When Expanded=false, the contents of the control are completely hidden. The height of the control will simply be the height of the Header (if visible). Use the ExpandEffect to control custom behaviors associated with the expand action. The Header appearance can also be customized for the different states (expanded or collapsed).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.ExpandEffect
member.summary: The ExpandEffect provides special behavior for showing/hiding the content associated with this control.
member.remarks: The ExpandEffect can be used to create graphical effects during the Expaned state transitions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.JavaScriptFileName
member.summary: The JavaScriptFileName is used to customize the path which is used to locate the JavaScriptFile necessary for this control to function on the Client-Side.
member.remarks: In general you do not need to modify this property value. However, if you wish to change the path which the JavaScriptFiles are located, you will need to modify this value accordingly. You can also use a Config file to specify a different value. For more information on using a config file, see the Deployment guide section of the help - Images and Deployment

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.BrowserTarget
member.summary: The BrowserTarget is used to force the control to render its contents tailored to specific browser, or category of browsers.
member.remarks: Use this property to force the control to render its contents tailored for a specific browser, regardless of the actual target browser which is requesting the page.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.ExpandedStateChangedEventHandler
member.summary: The ExpandedStateChangedEventHandler can be used to handle Expand events for the WebPanel. An ExpandedStateChangedEvent will fire when the panel is expanded or collapsed. Use the AutoPostBack property to control whether the WebPanel postsback in response to a change in the Expanded state.
member.param: The object responsible for firing the event.
The EventArgs associated with this event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.ExpandedStateChangedEventArgs
member.summary: This class is used to provide information regarding the ExpandedStateChanged event, to any handlers.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.ExpandedStateChangingEventHandler
member.summary: The ExpandedStateChangingEventHandler can be used to handle Expanding events for the WebPanel. An ExpandedStateChangingEvent will fire when the panel is about to expand or collapse. Use the AutoPostBack property to control whether the WebPanel will postsback in response to this event (before the expanded state has actually changed).
member.remarks:
This event can be cancelled by setting the
Cancel property off of the
EventArgs.
member.param: The object responsible for firing this event.
The event arguments which are associated with this event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.ExpandedStateChangingEventArgs
member.summary: The ExpandedStatechangingEventArgs are used to provide information to handlers for the ExpandedStateChanging event.
member.remarks: Use the Cancel property to cancel the event, and keep the ExpandingState from changing. You can determine the current state of the control by checking the Expanded Property (Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanel.ExpandedStateChangingEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Used to cancel the Expanded state change, about to be performed on the WebPanel.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPanelDefaultConstants
member.summary: Summary description for WebPanelDefaultConstants.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.Util.ClientStateXmlParser
member.summary: Summary description for ClientStateXmlParser.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TextAlignment
member.summary: The TextAlignment Enumeration describes the different horizontal alignment values that can be used to display text.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TextAlignment.Left
member.summary: The Text is Left-Aligned, appearing closest to the left-most edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TextAlignment.Center
member.summary: The Text is centered between the left and right edge of the container.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TextAlignment.Right
member.summary: The text is Right-Aligned, appearing closest to the right-most edge.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.ExpandEffect
member.summary: The ExpandEffect values can be used to describe how the Panel will expand and collapse. When set to None, the panel content will simply appear or disappear. All other values describe special effects.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.ExpandEffect.None
member.summary: The content will simply appear or disappear. No special effect will be used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.ExpandEffect.Slide
member.summary: The content will roll-up, or unroll based on whether it is collapsing or expanding. On supported browsers (Currently only Internet Exploerer), the content will also slowly fade to and from transparent while also rolling up or down.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.LocalizedCategoryAttribute.GetLocalizedString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the localized category name.
member.param: Name of the category to retreive.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.UltraLicenseAttribute.LicensedWithProducts
member.summary: Return the list of products that this control can be licensed with
